result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob A. Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob A. Johnson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of $443 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $543; due in $25 incriments per month, beginning 2/15/16 and on the 15th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 5 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, for each payment missed. 
To submit a DNA Sample

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A. Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy of the Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission returned by JCSD

Case called at 1:35 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jacob A. Johnson in court. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case file documents, indicates that Mr. Johnson was to provide letter from doctor for prior missed appearance
DA Happ informs the Court that the State was provided with letter; Court confirms quashing of warrant
DA Happ informs the Court that she did meet with Mr. Johnson, and did extend offer, unsure of his intent
Mr. Johnson informs the Court that he would like to accept the State's offer; DA Happ states offer for the record, submits CCS
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses repeater enhancer on Count #1

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses Count#2 outright 

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay costs of $443 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $543; due in $25 incriments per month, beginning 2/15/16 and on the 15th day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 5 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, for each payment missed. 
To submit a DNA Sample
Recess: 1:52 pm

Case recalled at 1:30 pm [sf]
Defendant Jacob A. Johnson in court. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews that the defendant failed to appear at the pretrial conference
Defendant explains that he had to take his daughter to the hospital to get breathing treatments.
Court finds that the defendant had good cause.
Court orders the defendant to provide a letter from the doctor within the next 7 days and submitt it to Judge Koschnick and a copy to the State..
Court quashes the warrant.
recess: 
NEXT: 
Pretrial Conference: 1/27/16 at 2:00 pm

Case called at 1:17 pm [sf]
Defendant Jacob A. Johnson not in court. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews that the defendant failed to appear at the scheduled pretrial conference yesterday, and todays hearing was set for the defendant to appear to show cause as to his non-appearance yesterday.
Attorney Flint requests a warrant.
Court grants request and orders a warrant.

recess: 1:18 pm
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 11:18 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jacob A. Johnson in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $150 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Bailey Reese  
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 11:22 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 1/20/16 at 1:40 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 1/29/16 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
